alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Polk; Story; Union; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:43PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Polk, southern Story, eastern Madison, northwestern Marion, eastern Union, western Jasper, Clarke, eastern Dallas and Warren Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dallas Center to near Avenue Of The Saints Event Center to 9 miles southeast of Creston. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Urbandale, Johnston, Waukee, Grimes, Granger, Saylorville Lake and Avenue Of The Saints Event Center around 1150 PM CDT. Polk City, Saylorville and Big Creek Lake around 1155 PM CDT. Norwalk and Slater around 1200 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Indianola, Huxley, Southridge Mall, Pleasant Hill, Carlisle, Lakeside Casino, Osceola and Prairie City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 27 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 105. Interstate 80 between mile markers 110 and 155. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and south central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Clarke; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Polk; Story; Union; Warren
